old_text: Global greenhouse gas emissions reached 59.1 gigatons of CO2 equivalent in 2021.
new_text: Global greenhouse gas emissions reached 62.3 gigatons of CO2 equivalent in 2022, a new all-time record.

children.text: The 2021 emissions (59.1 Gt CO2eq) represent a 12% increase compared to 2010, confirming the inadequacy of current climate commitments.
The goal of limiting warming to 1.5°C requires a 45% reduction in emissions by 2030 compared to 2010 levels.
The energy sector is responsible for 73% of total greenhouse gas emissions.
China is the world's largest emitter with 30% of annual global emissions.

old_text: The carbon price in the EU ETS reached 101 euros per ton in February 2023.
new_text: The carbon price in the EU ETS dropped to 58 euros per ton in March 2024, due to declining industrial demand.

children.text: The record price of 101 EUR/ton in the EU ETS reflects the growing effectiveness of the European carbon pricing mechanism.
EU ETS revenues, driven by the high carbon price, fund the energy transition of member states.
The EU's CBAM aims to tax carbon-intensive imports to prevent carbon leakage.
It is recommended to invest in carbon capture and storage technologies to complement market mechanisms.

old_text: France has 100,000 public charging points for electric vehicles.
new_text: France now has 150,000 public charging points for electric vehicles, reaching 37.5% of the target of 400,000 charging stations by 2030.

children.text: With 100,000 charging stations deployed, France must accelerate the installation rate by a factor of 4 to reach the target of 400,000 stations by 2030.
It is recommended to simplify the permitting process for installing charging stations in condominiums.
Electric vehicle sales accounted for 15.6% of new vehicle registrations in 2022.

old_text: Venture capital investments in Europe totaled 52 billion euros in 2022, down 35% from the record 80 billion in 2021.
new_text: Venture capital investments in Europe rebounded to 68 billion euros in 2023, up 31% compared to 2022, driven by the AI sector.

children.text: The 35% decline in European venture capital in 2022 reflects a global correction following the 2021 euphoria.
Deep tech captured 38% of European VC investments in 2023, confirming a structural shift toward breakthrough technologies.
Down rounds accounted for 18% of deals in 2023, signaling a valuation adjustment.
France ranks second in Europe with 28 unicorns.
It is recommended to strengthen European fund-of-funds to maintain investment momentum.

old_text: The global average temperature has increased by 1.1°C compared to the pre-industrial period.
new_text: The average global warming stands at 1.1°C above pre-industrial levels.

children.text: The 1.1°C increase in global temperature confirms the warming trajectory predicted by climate models.
Without significant emission reductions, the 1.5°C threshold will be exceeded as early as 2030-2035.
It is urgent to accelerate decarbonization to limit warming below 1.5°C.

old_text: The transport sector remains the largest CO2 emitter in France with 31% of national emissions.
new_text: In France, transport remains the highest carbon dioxide emitting sector, accounting for 31% of the country's emissions.

children.text: With transport being the leading source of emissions (31%), the electrification of the vehicle fleet is the primary decarbonization lever in France.
Electric vehicle sales accounted for 15.6% of new vehicle registrations in 2022.
It is recommended to accelerate the deployment of charging stations to support the transition to electric vehicles.
Road freight accounts for 44% of transport sector emissions in France.

old_text: Europe is short of 347,000 cybersecurity specialists in 2023.
new_text: In 2023, Europe's shortage of qualified cybersecurity professionals is estimated at 347,000 positions.

children.text: The shortage of 347,000 cybersecurity experts in Europe weakens organizations' ability to respond to growing threats.
The average salary for a cybersecurity expert in France has reached 72,000 euros gross annually, up 18%.
It is recommended to create accelerated cybersecurity training programs to bridge the skills gap.

old_text: Coral reefs have lost 50% of their coverage since 1950.
new_text: Since the mid-twentieth century, global coral reefs have seen their surface area reduced by half.

children.text: The loss of 50% of coral coverage since 1950 jeopardizes 25% of marine biodiversity that depends on these ecosystems.
A 2°C warming would lead to the disappearance of 99% of tropical reefs.
It is recommended to establish marine protected areas covering 30% of the oceans by 2030.

old_text: The average cost of a data breach in Europe reached 4.35 million euros in 2022, up 12.7% compared to 2021.
new_text: The average cost of a data breach for a European company stands at 4.78 million euros in 2023, an increase of 9.9% compared to 2022.

children.text: The continued increase in the cost of data breaches (4.35 million euros in 2022, +12.7%) justifies strengthening investments in preventive cybersecurity.
The sectors most targeted by cyberattacks are healthcare (18%), public administration (16%), and financial services (14%).
The average time to detect an intrusion is 197 days in Europe.
It is recommended to allocate a minimum of 10% of the IT budget to cybersecurity for exposed companies.

old_text: Investments in renewable energy reached 495 billion dollars in 2022, surpassing investments in fossil fuels for the first time.
new_text: Global investments in renewable energy reached 623 billion dollars in 2023, widening the gap with fossil fuel investments for the second consecutive year.

children.text: Crossing the symbolic threshold of 495 billion dollars in 2022 marks a historic turning point in green finance.
China installed 125 GW of solar capacity in 2022, more than the rest of the world combined.
It is recommended to redirect fossil fuel subsidies toward renewable energy to accelerate the transition.
The growing investments in renewables confirm that the energy transition has become economically attractive for investors.

old_text: 55% of Fortune 500 companies launched at least one generative AI pilot project in 2023, compared to 12% in 2022.
new_text: 78% of Fortune 500 companies deployed at least one generative AI project in production in 2024, compared to 55% in pilot phase in 2023.

children.text: The rapid adoption of generative AI (from 12% to 55% in one year among the Fortune 500) reflects an unprecedented technological paradigm shift.
67% of executives express concerns about governance and intellectual property risks related to generative AI.
The global generative AI market is estimated at 44.9 billion dollars in 2023.
It is recommended to establish an AI governance framework before any production deployment.

old_text: The share of renewable energy in France's electricity production reached 26.9% in 2022, compared to 19.1% in 2015.
new_text: The share of renewable energy in France's electricity production rose to 29.8% in 2023, continuing the upward trend since 2015 (19.1%).

children.text: The growth of renewables (26.9% in 2022) remains insufficient to meet the target of 40% of the electricity mix by 2030.
Nuclear power still provides 63% of French electricity.
The pace of new wind capacity installations slowed by 15% in 2022.
It is recommended to simplify permitting procedures to accelerate the deployment of renewables.
